revision.comment: Added relevant appearances to Podcast section.
revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=January 2014}} {{Infobox comedian <!-- for individuals - see Template:Infobox comedian for usage --> | name = Mike Lawrence | image = [[File:Mike Lawrence performing live.jpeg|250px]] | image_size = | alt = | caption = | pseudonym = | birth_name = Michael Patrick Lawrence | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1983|01|14}} | birth_place = Miami, Florida<ref name="We Love DC - Simple Coverage">{{cite news|last=Palafox|first=Patrick|title=Comedy in DC: Mike Lawrence|url=http://www.welovedc.com/2011/04/13/comedy-in-dc-mike-lawrence/|accessdate=October 3, 2013|newspaper=We Love DC|date=April 13, 2011}}</ref> | death_date = | death_place = | medium = Stand-up | nationality = American | active = 2005â€“present | genre = | subject = | influences = [[The Simpsons]], [[Patton Oswalt]], [[Dr. Seuss]], [[Marvel Comics|Marvel]] comics from the 60s to early 90s, his parents<ref name="Reddit AMA">{{cite web|last=Lawrence|first=Mike|title=Mike Lawrence AMA|url=https://www.reddit.com/r/standupshots/comments/13xzs3/mike_lawrence_ama/|publisher=[[Reddit]] AMA|accessdate=October 3, 2013}}</ref> | influenced = | spouse = Adina Pliskin | domesticpartner = | notable_work = | signature = | website = {{url|http://www.mikelawrencecomedy.com/}} | footnotes = | module = }} '''Michael Patrick "Mike" Lawrence''' is an American comedian and writer from [[Davie, Florida]]. He currently lives in New York City.<ref name="We Love DC - Simple Coverage" />
==Early life== Lawrence was born in Miami but grew up in Davie, Florida. He attended [[Western High School (Davie, Florida)|Western High School]] and earned a bachelor's degree from [[Florida Atlantic University]] in English.
When he was 16 years old, he began working at a [[McDonald's]] in southern Florida. He attributes his ability to deal with [[heckler]]s to his time spent at McDonald's working the drive-thru. In his podcast interview on ''[[WTF with Marc Maron]]'', he stated, "Heckling doesn't bother me because I've been yelled at for McNuggets."<ref name="Good Morning America - McDonalds Info">{{cite news|last=Kim|first=Sussana|title=Working at a McDonald's Drive-thru Gave Comedian Confidence|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Business/york-comedian-mike-lawrence-practiced-telling-jokes-mcdonalds/story?id=16212218|accessdate=October 3, 2013|newspaper=[[Good Morning America]]|date=April 26, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite podcast| url=http://www.wtfpod.com/podcast/episodes/episode_241_-_mike_lawrence| title=WTF with Marc Maron | publisher=[[Earwolf]] | host=[[Marc Maron]] | date=December 6, 2012 | accessdate=October 17, 2015}}</ref>
==Career== Lawrence started his career at the age of 15 by performing poetry at open mic nights in 1998. After realizing that the part he liked most about it was making people laugh, he moved to comedy.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Irvin|first1=Zuri|title=Writing Jokes with Mike Lawrence|url=https://medium.com/@withzuri/writing-jokes-with-mike-lawrence-30d4cae07514#.oicqzwok0|website=Medium|publisher=Medium.com|accessdate=20 Dec 2015}}</ref><ref name="We Love DC - Simple Coverage" />
In 2010, Lawrence was named one of the New Faces at the largest comedy festival in the world, ''[[Just for Laughs]]''.<ref name="LaughSpin - Just For Laughs New Faces">{{cite news|last=Gadino|first=Dylan P.|title=Just For Laughs: Feimster, Lawrence, Jost impress at New Faces|url=http://www.laughspin.com/2010/07/16/just-for-laughs-feimster-lawrence-jost-impress-at-new-faces/|accessdate=October 3, 2013|newspaper=[[LaughSpin]]|date=July 16, 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130426110556/http://www.laughspin.com/2010/07/16/just-for-laughs-feimster-lawrence-jost-impress-at-new-faces/|archivedate=April 26, 2013|df=mdy-all}}</ref> He later performed at the festival in 2012 at both the [[Montreal]] and Chicago festivals.<ref name="LaughSpin - New Faces">{{cite news|title=Nikki Glaser, Brody Stevens, Jonah Ray and 14 more comedians to film half-hour specials for Comedy Central|url=http://www.laughspin.com/2013/02/14/nikki-glaser-brody-stevens-jonah-ray-and-14-more-comedians-to-film-half-hour-specials-for-comedy-central/|accessdate=October 3, 2013|newspaper=[[LaughSpin]]|date=February 14, 2013}}</ref> While in Montreal, he recorded a set for [[HBO Canada]]'s ''[[Funny as Hell]]''.
In 2011, Lawrence performed at [[Lance Bangs]]' ''[[Come Laugh With Us]]'' at the [[Birdgetown Comedy Festival]] with fellow features [[Kristen Schaal]], [[Fred Armisen]], [[Jon Daly (comedian)|Jon Daly]], and [[Brett Gelman]].<ref name="LaughSpin - Bridgetown Comedy Festival">{{cite news|last=Kate|first=Meagan|title=Bridgetown Comedy Festival: Day 2|url=http://www.laughspin.com/2011/04/23/bridgetown-comedy-festival-day-2/|accessdate=October 3, 2013|newspaper=[[LaughSpin]]|date=April 23, 2011}}</ref> Mike also performed on ''[[John Oliver (comedian)|John Oliver]]'s [[John Oliver's New York Stand-Up Show|New York Stand-Up Show]]'' with fellow features [[Hannibal Buress]], [[Michael Ian Black]], and [[Hari Kondabolu]].<ref name="LaughSpin - John Oliver's Show">{{cite news|last=Gardner|first=Lucas|title=John Oliver's New York Stand-Up Show is back July 20, so let's watch a preview!|url=http://www.laughspin.com/2012/07/06/john-olivers-new-york-stand-up-show-is-back-july-20-so-lets-watch-a-preview/|accessdate=October 3, 2013|newspaper=[[LaughSpin]]|date=July 6, 2012}}</ref> He regularly opened for Oliver soon after.
In 2012, Lawrence also made his first appearance on [[Conan O'Brien]]'s TV show, [[Conan (talk show)|Conan]].
In 2013, his comedy album ''[[Sadamantium]]'' was released by [[Comedy Central Records]] in conjunction with his half-hour special on ''[[The Half Hour]]''.<ref name="AV Club - Sadamantium Review">{{cite news|last=Heisler|first=Steve|title=Mike Lawrence: Sadamantium|url=http://www.avclub.com/articles/mike-lawrence-sadamantium,98182/|accessdate=October 3, 2013|newspaper=[[The A.V. Club]]|date=May 28, 2013}}</ref> ''Sadamantium'' was recorded at the [[Nerdist Showroom]] at [[Meltdown Comics]].<ref name="Under the Gun - Sadamantium Review">{{cite news|last=Frissore|first=Angie|title=STAND UP TUESDAYS: MIKE LAWRENCE|url=http://www.underthegunreview.net/2013/06/04/stand-up-tuesdays-mike-lawrence/|accessdate=October 3, 2013|newspaper=[[Under the Gun Review]]|date=June 4, 2013}}</ref> The album received positive reviews from [[The Huffington Post]], [[The A.V. Club]], [[America's Comedy]], and [[The Laugh Button]].<ref name="AV Club - Sadamantium Review" /><ref name="HuffPo - Sadamantium Review">{{cite news|last=Bartolone|first=Tony|title=Mike Lawrence's Sadamantium|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/tony-bartolone/mike-lawrences-sadamantiu_b_3417566.html|accessdate=October 3, 2013|newspaper=[[The Huffington Post]]|date=June 11, 2013}}</ref><ref name="Laugh Button - Sadamantium Review">{{cite news|last=DiCostanzo|first=Ben|title=Mike Lawrence, 'Sadamantium' (review)|url=http://thelaughbutton.com/features/mike-lawrence-sadamantium-review/|accessdate=October 3, 2013|newspaper=[[The Laugh Button]]|date=July 1, 2013}}</ref><ref name="America's Comedy - Sadamantium Review">{{cite news|last=Schildgen|first=Alex|title=Mike Lawrence and Nerdish Insecurities: â€˜Sadamantiumâ€™|url=http://www.americascomedy.com/comedy-review-mike-lawrence-and-nerdish-insecurities-sadamantium/|accessdate=October 3, 2013|newspaper=[[America's Comedy]]|date=May 24, 2013}}</ref> In September, he wrote a piece for [[The Huffington Post]] called ''The Five Most Important Things I've Learned Doing Comedy in New York That I'd Pass on To Newer Comics'' where he shares his feelings about comedy and his career.<ref name="HuffPo - 5 Important Things">{{cite news|last=Lawrence|first=Mike|title=The Five Most Important Things I've Learned Doing Comedy in New York That I'd Pass on To Newer Comics|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/mike-lawrence/the-five-most-important-t_b_3862058.html|accessdate=October 3, 2013|newspaper=[[The Huffington Post]]|date=September 3, 2013}}</ref> He performed again on [[Conan (talk show)|Conan]] in this year. Lawrence wrote a piece for and was a guest on [[W. Kamau Bell]]'s show [[Totally Biased with W. Kamau Bell|Totally Biased]].
===Podcasts=== Lawrence hosts the ''[[Nerd of Mouth]]'' podcast with Jake Young on the New York City-based comedy podcast network, [[Cave Comedy Radio]]. Episodes are published weekly. Topics discussed on the podcast include comic books, video games, TV shows, and movies; things that Lawrence enjoys.<ref name="Nerd of Mouth Description">{{cite web|title=Nerd of Mouth|url=http://cavecomedyradio.com/nerdofmouth|publisher=[[Cave Comedy Radio]]|accessdate=October 3, 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130818190745/http://cavecomedyradio.com/nerdofmouth|archivedate=August 18, 2013|df=mdy-all}}</ref> Lawrence and the podcast were featured on an episode of [[Toy Hunter]] in the episode called [[Toy Hunter#Season 2 (2013)|Nerd of Mouth]], in 2013.<ref name="TV.com - Toy Hunter Listing">{{cite web|title=Toy Hunter, Season 2, Episode 8|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/toy-hunter/nerd-of-mouth-2848283/|publisher=[[TV.com]]|accessdate=October 3, 2013}}</ref><ref name="Marvel Interview">{{cite news|last=Garris|first=Blake|title=The Marvel Life: Mike Lawrence|url=http://marvel.com/news/story/20668/the_marvel_life_mike_lawrence|accessdate=October 8, 2013|newspaper=[[Marvel Comics]]|date=May 23, 2013}}</ref>
Lawrence has also been a guest on many notable podcasts, including ''[[You Know What Dude!]]'' with comedian [[Robert Kelly (comedian)|Robert Kelly]], ''[[You Made It Weird with Pete Holmes|You Made It Weird]]'' with comedian [[Pete Holmes]], ''[[WTF with Marc Maron|WTF]]'' podcast with comedian [[Marc Maron]], [[The Adam Carolla Show (podcast)|The Adam Carolla Show]] with [[Adam Carolla]], [[Keith and The Girl]] with [[Keith Malley]], [[The K Ohle with Kurt Braunohler|The K Ohle Show]] with [[Kurt Braunohler]], [[Earwolf#Hollywood Handbook|Hollywood Handbook]] with [[Sean Clements]] and [[Hayes Davenport]], [[The Artie Lange Show]] hosted by comedian [[Artie Lange]], "What Say You?" with Brian "Q" Quinn and Sal Vulcano of [[Impractical Jokers]], and "What Do You Know?" with [[Joel Heyman]] of [[Rooster Teeth]].
==Personal life== Lawrence's mother was a stand-up comedian and he has one brother and sister.<ref name="TimesSquare.com - Born Into Comedy">{{cite news|last=Lohne|first=Megan|title=Mike Lawrence: Born into Comedy|url=http://www.timessquare.com/Stage/Interviews/Mike_Lawrence:_Born_into_Comedy/|accessdate=October 8, 2013|newspaper=TimesSquare.com|date=February 21, 2013}}</ref> Lawrence married Adina Pliskin in 2014.<ref>https://selexperienceproject.com/2018/02/05/filmmaker-adina-pliskin-brush-class-of-2002/</ref>
==Filmography==

Role ! class="unsortable" | Notes |- |2011â€“2012 |''[[John Oliver's New York Stand-Up Show]]'' | Himself | Two episodes |- |2012 |''Naked Truth'' | Writer | [[TBS (U.S. TV channel)|TBS]] pilot for panel comedy show hosted by [[Tom Papa]] |- |2012â€“2013 |''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'' | Himself | Guest comedian |- |2013 |''[[The Half Hour]]'' | Himself | |- |2013 |''[[Totally Biased with W. Kamau Bell]]'' | Himself | One episode. Wrote a piece for the show. |- |2013 |''[[Toy Hunter]]'' | Himself | Featured in the episode [[Toy Hunter#Season 2 (2013)|Nerd of Mouth]] |- | 2013-2014 | ''[[@midnight]]'' | Himself | Five episodes |- | 2016 | ''Roast Battle'' | Himself | First Place Winner |}
